discussion_comments.comment_body: Hardcoded production database name in default configuration

<!-- metadata:{"confidence":9,"steps":[]} -->
Using a hidden property for 'Base URL' may prevent users from configuring custom endpoints via the UI, which could be limiting for enterprise or proxy use cases. Consider making this property visible and optionally advanced.

Is there a reason we can't compare like this? Passing _anything_ other than literally `false` will cause us to skip, e.g. `0`

```suggestion
export const skipAuthOnOAuthCallback = process.env.N8N_SKIP_AUTH_ON_OAUTH_CALLBACK === 'true';
```
Because we want it to default to `true` if it hasn't been defined. I know, it's very convoluted
I'll try to make it easier to read

<!-- metadata:{"confidence":8,"steps":[]} -->
CHAT_BUNDLE_DIST_DIR is calculated by walking three directories up from __dirname and then into "packages/frontend/@n8n/chat/dist". These folders exist only in the monorepo during development and are not shipped with the compiled CLI package published to npm, so this path will resolve to a non-existent directory in production installations, causing /chat assets to 404 at runtime.
